content: #Blog #Books: Hard Sci-Fi: collapsed:: true “Artemis” – Andy Weir Desc: If you liked The Martian, this is another fun, science-heavy adventure, this time on the Moon. “Delta-V” – Daniel Suarez Desc: A realistic take on asteroid mining with excellent technical detail and a thrilling plot. “The Bobiverse Series” – Dennis E. Taylor Desc: A fun, science-heavy series about an AI-controlled self-replicating spaceship exploring the universe. “Children of Time” – Adrian Tchaikovsky Desc: A deeply intelligent book about evolution, artificial intelligence, and humanity’s place in the cosmos. “Seveneves” – Neal Stephenson Desc: A hard sci-fi epic about humanity’s survival after Earth faces destruction. “The Long Way to a Small, Angry Planet” – Becky Chambers Desc: Less hard sci-fi but an amazing character-driven space adventure with humor and heart. Space Opera: collapsed:: true “The Revelation Space Series” – Alastair Reynolds Desc: A mix of space opera and hard sci-fi, with deep world-building and realistic physics. “The Red Rising Series” – Pierce Brown Desc: A fast-paced, action-packed mix of sci-fi and political intrigue. “The Void Trilogy” – Peter F. Hamilton Desc: A massive space opera with deep, intricate storytelling and far-future civilizations. “The Murderbot Diaries” – Martha Wells Desc: A sarcastic AI security bot navigates human interactions in space while dealing with existential dread. “The Hyperion Cantos” – Dan Simmons Desc: A deeply philosophical and epic space opera with rich storytelling. “The Commonwealth Saga” – Peter F. Hamilton Desc: Another incredible space opera full of intrigue, AI, and interstellar adventure. #Movies Flow A complete unknown Companion
